_header: The second day of fair fresh lusty May
Title(s): ‘Thoughts on the Second Day of May’
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, ‘Thoughts on the Second Day of May’, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 122) — three 10-line stanzas (ababbccdcd) and 4-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
THe secund day of fayre fresshe lusty mayAs half in slepe in
                    slombir half wakyng…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…For where ye seme y axen shulde merceMe thynke y haue
                    deservid not wherfore
